author: Nathan Worcester, Ryan Morgan
description: U.S. forces have conducted at least 19 strikes on suspected drug trafficking vessels in the waters around Latin America since September.
title: House Armed Services Chair Urges Trump Admin to Publicly Disclose Legal Basis for Boat Strikes

author: Jacki Thrapp
description: The BBC’s Director-General Tim Davie and CEO of News Deborah Turness resigned after the scandal.
title: BBC Apologizes to Trump for Misleading Viewers With Jan. 6 Speech Edit

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Cowichan Tribes is calling on Ottawa to help it clean up an illegal dump site polluting a river on its land in Duncan, B.C., a request that B.C. Conservative Leader John Rustad says shows a “double standard” by the reserve’s leadership. Cowichan Tribes say federal regulations have prevented them from bringing a stop to illegal […]
title: Cowichan Tribes Putting Dump Site Onus on Ottawa Shows ‘Double Standard,’ BC Conservative Leader Says

author: Matthew Horwood
description: OTTAWA—The head of Canada’s spy agency says agents from the People’s Republic of China have been attempting to recruit Canadians with access to government and military information to work for Beijing. “Chinese spies have tried to recruit Canadians with access to government plans, intentions, information, and military expertise, through social media and online job platforms,” […]
title: Chinese Spies Trying to Recruit Canadians, Spy Chief Warns in First Annual Address

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The Ontario patient ombudsman office looked into a record number of complaints involving health-care facilities last year, including one case that resulted in the death of an elderly patient. There were 4,886 new complaints lodged last year, reflecting a 16 percent rise in written complaints and an 8 percent increase in call centre complaints compared […]
title: Patient Complaints on Rise in Ontario, Ombudsman Reports

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney has unveiled the second batch of so-called nation-building projects that will be referred to the Major Projects Office (MPO) for fast-tracking. The new list includes mining projects in New Brunswick, Quebec, and Ontario, a liquified natural gas (LNG) project and a transmission line in B.C., and a hydroelectricity project in Nunavut. […]
title: Carney’s Second Set of Major Projects Includes Mining, LNG, Electricity Projects

author: Chandra Philip
description: The Ontario government is introducing new requirements for school boards to create dedicated offices to handle unresolved concerns from parents and students. The government made the announcement in a release on Nov. 13, saying every school board in the province will be required to have plans in place for a “Student and Family Support Office” […]
title: Ontario to Open School Board Support Offices to Help Resolve Parent Concerns

author: The Canadian Press
description: Riding a record backlog, AtkinsRéalis Group Inc. CEO Ian Edwards sees more room for big gains as Canada and other Western countries look to shore up crumbling infrastructure and bulk up their militaries amid growing global strife. “Recent NATO commitments by the Canadian government are likely to yield further opportunities for our defence expertise. And […]
title: AtkinsRéalis Looks to Seize on Spending Ramp-Up for Defence, Major Projects

author: The Canadian Press
description: Oilsands giant Cenovus Energy Inc. has completed its takeover of MEG Energy Corp. The two companies had neighbouring properties in the oilsands at Christina Lake, south of Fort McMurray, Alta. With the purchase, Cenovus gets another 110,000 barrels a day of production from what had been MEG’s flagship operation. “The addition of MEG assets and […]
title: MEG Takeover Saga Draws to Close as Cenovus Completes Purchase

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The German government hopes to boost the size of its armed forces to 270,000 men and women by 2035.
title: Germany Unveils New Military Service Plan, With Conscription an Option

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The 'alarming' increase is believed to be largely related to the concurrent rise in global rates of obesity, academics said.
title: Blood Pressure Rates Surge in Children Worldwide, Study Finds

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Ontario broke ground this week on what Premier Doug Ford is describing as the largest battery energy storage facility in the country, a project that he says will help counteract U.S. tariffs. Ford says the Skyview 2 Battery Energy Storage System will store electricity from Ontario’s clean grid during periods of low demand and discharge […]
title: Ontario Starts Build of Major Battery Energy Storage Plant

author: Frank Fang
description: 'Iran exploits financial systems to launder funds, procure components for its nuclear and conventional weapons programs,’ a Treasury Department official said.
title: US Sanctions Global Entities Supporting Iran’s Missile, Drone Capabilities

author: Catherine Yang
description: As of January, China was estimated to possess at least 600 nuclear warheads, double what it had in 2020, according to one think tank.
title: G7 Nations Concerned With China’s Military, Nuclear Buildup

author: Guy Birchall
description: 130 people were killed by ISIS terrorists across Paris on the night of Nov. 13, 2015, in an attack that shocked France, Europe, and the world.
title: France Remembers Paris ISIS Attack 10 Years On

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: Businesses and officials in the United States, Qatar, France, and Germany have been urging the EU to relax the rules.
title: EU Votes to Scale Back Corporate Sustainability Rules

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Public Health Agency of Canada lost more than $20 million worth of pharmaceutical products from the national stockpile this year because of what it calls a “temperature deviation.” The figure was reported in the 2025 public accounts but Health Canada refuses to say what was lost, citing national security implications. In a statement, Health […]
title: Health Canada Won’t Explain $20M in Pharmaceuticals Lost From National Stockpile

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Foreign Affairs Minister Anita Anand says she did not address stalled trade negotiations between Ottawa and the United States during her meeting with her U.S. counterpart at the G7 summit this week. Anand said she met with U.S. Secretary of State Marco Rubio on the margins of the G7 in the Niagara region this week […]
title: Anand and Rubio Prioritize Global Issues at G7, Leaving Canada-US Trade Off the Agenda

author: Chandra Philip
description: More than 2,700 kilograms of cannabis concealed within shipments of lumber and paper towel intended for the United Kingdom has been confiscated in Montreal, thwarting a potential smuggling operation that may support organized crime, Canadian border authorities say. The drugs were seized in two separate shipments from Montreal’s Marine and Rail Service port in September, […]
title: Canada Border Agency Seizes 2,700 Kilos of Cannabis Destined for UK

author: Naveen Athrappully
description: During the Biden administration, the IEA predicted that global oil demand would peak this decade.
title: IEA Predicts World Oil and Gas Demand Will Grow Till 2050

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The United States has signaled that a compromise on the tariff is within reach, though no final figure has been set.
title: Swiss Officials to Resume Tariff Talks in Washington

author: Alex Wu
description: The unusual publicity of such cases by the regime is intended for deterrence, while indicating tightened control, said analysts.
title: CCP Unusually Publicizes Case of Retired Intelligence Officer Leaking Classified Information to Foreign Entities

author: PA Media
description: It is “simply not sustainable” for teachers to spend so much of their own time tackling their workload, a union chief has said, as she urged members to back strike action over a dispute on class contact time. The SNP pledged in its manifesto ahead of the 2021 election to reduce contact time to 21 […]
title: Teacher Workload ‘Not Sustainable’ Union Says as Strike Action Ballot Opens

author: PA Media
description: Military driving examiners are to be mobilised to cut the test backlog for civilians, the Government has announced. Up to 6,500 more tests will be made available over the next year at locations with the highest demand, the Department for Transport (DfT) said. Thirty-six defence driving examiners (DDEs) will conduct public tests one day a […]
title: Military Driving Examiners Deployed to Public Test Centres to Cut Backlog

author: PA Media
description: The owner of Royal Mail has said it will not roll out changes that will see it ditch second-class letter deliveries on Saturdays more widely across the UK until early next year. International Distribution Services (IDS) – which was bought by Czech billionaire Daniel Kretinsky’s EP Group last year for £3.6 billion – has been […]
title: Royal Mail Not Rolling Out Further Changes to Second-Class Post Until Early 2026

author: Melanie Sun
description: 'Our success in countering the ISIS threat in Syria is a notable achievement,' CENTCOM commander Adm. Brad Cooper said.
title: Five ISIS Terrorists Killed, 19 Captured in Syria: US CENTCOM

author: Rachel Roberts
description: The IOC set up a scientific group to evaluate the persistence of male physical advantage even after testosterone suppressing treatment.
title: Olympic Committee Moves Toward Banning Trans-Identifying Males From Women’s Sports

author: Nicole James
description: An Ayurvedic herb that strengthens the mind, body and spirit
title: Why Everyone’s Talking About ‘Ashwagandha’ (And Why You Should Know About It)

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The Liberal Party's shift comes amid pressure from its right faction, several membership votes against net zero, as well as One Nation.
title: Opposition Cites Affordability Before Ideology in Move to Drop Net Zero Target

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A leading Australian women's rights group says the South Australian government has failed to act more than a month after a woman claimed to have been assaulted.
title: Alarm Raised Over Safety in Australian Prisons After Claims of Assault by Trans Inmate

author: Olivia Li
description: The global streaming industry is undergoing a major shift as digital platforms move from subscriptions to ad-supported video.
title: Seoul OTT Forum Highlights Streaming’s Shift Toward Ad-Supported Video and AI Advertising

author: Michael Zhuang
description: One engineer said the bridge’s location, not its design, was the real flaw.
title: Why China’s Hongqi Bridge Collapsed Before Opening

author: Lily Zhou
description: An international lawmaker alliance said it will also push for actions opposing Beijing's coercive activities against Taiwan, Tibet, and others.
title: Global Lawmakers Pledge to Push Ban on Forced Organ Harvesting

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A teenager who fatally stabbed a Queensland grandmother will serve just 60 percent of his sentence.
title: Brisbane Grandma Murderer to Walk Free by 2033

author: PA Media
description: Sir Keir Starmer has condemned “completely unacceptable” briefings against Health Secretary Wes Streeting as a civil war erupted at the top of the Labour Party. Mr Streeting has categorically denied that he was plotting to oust the Prime Minister and called for those in No 10 briefing against him to face the sack. At Prime […]
title: Starmer Condemns ‘Unacceptable’ Attack on Streeting Amid Leadership Row

author: Reuters
description: KYIV—President Volodymyr Zelenskiy called for the dismissal of two cabinet ministers on Wednesday amid a probe into an alleged $100 million corruption scheme involving a former associate that has fuelled fresh public anger at Kyiv’s wartime government. Anti-corruption authorities said this week they had detained five people and identified two others still at large, suspected […]
title: Ukraine Moves to Quell $100 Million Energy Corruption Scandal

author: Jill McLaughlin
description: A bipartisan investigation into China’s dominance over rare earth and critical minerals revealed the regime's predatory practices.
title: Bipartisan Congressional Report Finds CCP Manipulates Global Mineral Prices

author: Reuters
description: SYDNEY–Australia’s highest court on Wednesday blocked Russia from building a new embassy in the nation’s capital, unanimously upholding a law that cancelled its lease on national security grounds. Russia owned a lease to a plot of land that is about 300 metres (984 feet) from Parliament House in Canberra and intended to build a new […]
title: Australia’s Top Court Blocks Russia From Building New Canberra Embassy

author: PA Media
description: Thousands of staff at aerospace firm Leonardo have walked out in a dispute over pay, on the first of a number of planned days of strike action. Hundreds of workers took to picket lines at the company’s site in Edinburgh, while similar scenes are understood to have taken place at the firm’s sites throughout Scotland […]
title: Thousands of Leonardo Staff Walk out in Dispute Over Pay

author: Dorothy Li
description: Despite facing backlash, Chinese state media have dialed up verbal attacks against Takaichi.
title: Japan Urged to Declare Chinese Diplomat ‘Persona Non Grata’ Over Death Threat to PM

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Asbestos found in kids’ craft sand triggers recalls across Australia and New Zealand.
title: Children’s Craft Sand Recalled After Asbestos Detected in Multiple Products

author: Kimberly Hayek
description: After a meeting with G7 nations in Canada, Rubio said none of the other countries broached the topic of U.S. actions in the Caribbean, including the UK.
title: Rubio Says Reports That UK Suspended Intelligence Sharing Over Caribbean Boat Strikes Is ‘False News’

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The move marks a major win for conservatives.
title: Liberal Party Walks Away From 2050 Net-Zero Commitment

author: Ryan Morgan
description: The shooting incident along the disputed Cambodian-Thai border comes two days after Thai soldiers were injured in a landmine blast.
title: Cambodia Reports Villager Killed by Thai Soldiers in Latest Sign of Faltering Peace

author: Carolina Avendano
description: When Alberta’s governing United Conservative Party holds its annual general meeting (AGM) later this month, members will debate a range of policy proposals, including greater provincial control over immigration, limits on non-governmental flags at public buildings, and full implementation of the province’s COVID-19 task force recommendations. Party members and stakeholders will discuss 36 policy resolutions […]
title: Immigration Control, Public Flag Policy, Bodily Autonomy Among Policy Resolutions at Alberta UCP Meeting

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Police say they have seized 46 kilograms of suspected fentanyl after a year-long drug investigation—an amount that is the largest in Ontario Provincial Police (OPP) history and which they say is enough of the drug to take the lives of a “moderately sized city.” In addition to the seizure of fentanyl, the bust resulted in […]
title: Largest Fentanyl Bust in Ontario Police History, Amount Seized Enough to Kill a Mid-Sized City: OPP

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Budget 2025 has exempted eight additional government departments and agencies from the requirement to cut program expenditures by 15 percent over the next three years, requiring them instead to reduce spending by only 2 percent. These new additions bring the total number of exempt departments and agencies to 11. The newly exempt organizations include those […]
title: More Government Departments Exempted From 15 Percent Spending Cut Target

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: The Treaty Bill will see a permanent Indigenous advisory body set up alongside the state's parliament.
title: Victoria’s Indigenous Treaty Signed Into Law, UN Calls It ‘Significant’

author: Olivia Gomm
description: A man is facing several charges after he drove off with an unattended Hamilton city bus, taking passengers on a “joy ride,” according to police. A city bus driver had pulled the bus into a local bus terminal in Hamilton, Ont., at approximately 9 p.m. on Nov. 11 and exited the bus for a short […]
title: Man Arrested Following ‘Joy Ride’ in Hamilton Bus With Passengers

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Canada is experiencing a considerable surge in violent crime not only in larger cities but also smaller communities with formerly low violent crime rates, indicating a broader problem with public safety in the country, according to a new study. An in-depth examination of 20 Canadian metropolitan areas reveals a nationwide decline in public safety and […]
title: Canada’s Cities and Smaller Urban Communities Seeing ‘Rising’ Violent Crime: New Study
